FuncDef:
The source-ip command configures a source IPv4 address listened on a gRPC server.
The undo source-ip command deletes a source IPv4 address listened on a gRPC server. The source-ip command configures a source IPv4 address listened on a gRPC server. The undo source-ip command deletes a source IPv4 address listened on a gRPC server. By default, no source IPv4 address is configured on a gRPC server.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a source IPv4 address to be listened.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the name of a VPN instance to be bound to the source IPv4 address to be listened.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters without spaces.
The value must be the name of an existing VPN instance.

ExtraInfo: If a collector functioning as a client initiates a connection to a device functioning as a server, the data sampled is dynamically subscribed to. In this case, on the server, configure a source IPv4 address to be listened and bind it to a VPN instance. A connection can then be established between the server and client.
